main.name: Rosie Cumming
main.description: As an educator who is passionate about inclusive education, I seek to explore the potential intersections between gender, literacy and digital innovation.
main.bio: I am a seasoned educator with proven management experience leading a large English department at an innovative online school. I have a track record of academic excellence, recently completing my MA in Education, Gender and International Development at University College London where I was the IOE-Clarke scholar for 2021-22.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: The following is a breakdown of my technical and practical skills

education.degree: Masters Degree in Education, Gender and International Development
education.description: I have recently completed my MA in Education, Gender and International Development where I was the IOE-Clarke scholar for 2021-22. This degree has enabled me to develop an understanding of the gender dimensions of research, analysis, policy and practice in relation to education in low-and-middle-income countries.

education.degree: Bachelor of Education (Honours) in Language and Literacy (Cum Laude)
education.description: I obtained my Honours degree while working full time at Wynberg Girls' Junior School. My Honours project which focused on linguistic inclusion in schools, obtained a final grade of 86% and was singled out by the external examiner.

education.degree: Postgraduate Certificate in Education (Foundation Phase and Early Childhood Development)
education.description: Majoring in Foundation Phase and Early Childhood Development has provided me a broad basis to understand the building blocks of our learning journey.

education.degree: Bachelor of Social Science in Sociology and Gender Studies
education.description: Majoring in Sociology and Gender Studies has provided me with the depth of understanding needed to further explore key challenges to educational inclusion facing South African learners today.

work.title: English Subject Lead
work.description: As head of the Junior School English department, I grew with the school as it expanded during its first year. During this time, I managed a large team in a dynamic and ever-changing online environment whilst delivering innovative online classes.

work.title: Prospero Education
work.description: As a supply teacher for Prospero Education, I worked in schools across London developing my teaching skills with learners from different year groups, socio-economic backgrounds and with varying levels of ability. As someone who thrives under pressure, I enjoyed the constantly evolving demands. This experiece allowed me to become a more intuitive and relaxed educator, solidifying my love for this sector.

work.title: Library Curator
work.description: As Library Curator my duties included not only the creation of engaging literacy lessons for Grades R to 7 but also the management of the library budget and stock.

work.title: Guest English Teacher
work.description: While in South Korea as a Guest English Teacher through the EPIK Programme, I taught English as a foreign language to students in Grades R to 6. This was an immensely rewarding experience which enabled me to work within a set curriculum whilst finding creative solutions to barriers to learning.

projects.title: Space Evaders
projects.category: A semester computer graphics course project hosted on GitHub

projects.title: Rafiki
projects.category: A group semester software development project from university

testimonials.text: Rosie was a superb student, coming out with the second to top mark in the entire Honours class for her degree as a whole. Her engagement with the research process was outstanding. Conducting a small empirical study, her data collection and analysis was excellent and will be used by me as a model in future classes.
testimonials.user: Associate Professor, UCT School of Education

testimonials.text: Rosie is by far one of the most exceptional English teachers I have ever managed. Rosie has garnered nothing but respect from her peers and they view her as a great leader. She also played a pivotal role as a Subject Lead in ensuring that the implementation and designing of sound policies and curriculum in the English department.
